IRS, Benghazi: Obama fends off two controversies

The president tried to swat down a pair of brewing issues: the targeting of conservative groups by the IRS and suggestions of a cover-up after deadly attacks in Benghazi, Libya in 2012. (5:15 p.m.)
  • Capuano: IRS targeting reminiscent of Nixon tactics  |  IRS apologizes for targeting tea party groups

Philly abortion doctor guilty in babies' deaths

Kermit Gosnell could face execution in the deaths of three babies who authorities say were delivered alive, then killed with scissors. (3:46 p.m.)
  • Guide to the abortion doctor trial
  • Pa. trial has national impact

From hospital room, driver pleads not guilty

Sean Jackman, who was accused of drunk driving in a crash that killed junior Evan Bard, had a plea of not guilty entered for him at his arraignment in a hospital room. (1:26 p.m.)
  • 5/12 Driver charged in crash that killed Curry cheerleader

Wilbur: Julien in the hot seat, again

The Bruins are forced to host the Maple Leafs in Game 7 Monday night thanks to their inability to show any spark of life, Eric Wilbur writes.
